intro: Boerhavia elegans var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a waxy surface, and the plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering habits.
